Because for all of the natural systems, you could say, well, evolution did that. Evolution gave you the goal. And that's what we normally say. Why does this animal look the way it looks? Why does it have behaviors that it has? Because of selection. Eons of selection gave you that goal. Okay, what happens in novel systems? I'm very interested in where goals come from. primary_topics: Role of Evolution in Shaping Organisms
Origin of Goals in Biological Systems
content_summary: The speaker discusses the concept of intelligence and the role of evolution in shaping the characteristics and behaviors of organisms. They express interest in understanding the origin of goals in biological systems, particularly in novel systems, and suggest that these goals may not solely come from evolution.
